DOC.brief_summary: The proposed study aims to objectively assess 2-year clinical and radiographic results for the rate of glenoid component loosening in total shoulder arthroplasty (TSA). This retrospective radiographic review will provide evidence for equivalence or superiority in curtailing loosening, a known complication in arthroplasty, when a hemostatic agent is utilized in conjunction with cement at the glenoid.
DOC.brief_title: A Retrospective Review of FloSeal Use in Total Shoulder Arthroplasty
DOC.criteria: Patients must have completed at least 2 years followup following their total shoulder replacement Patients must have had radiographic imaging obtained at that 2 years Patients less than 21 years of age Patients who have been imprisoned since the time of surgery Patients who are mentally impaired
